dialogues.text: While we stand together no invader shall pass. Let them come with all the armies of Hell, they will not pass.                                            The crowd gives another mighty cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let us sound the advance and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: go forward, together, you and I. I myself will be your general,                            judge and rewarder of every one                           of your virtues in the field.                             When this day of battle is ended, we meet again in heaven, or on the field of victory. he greatest shout of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 Dr Dee studies his charts. 129

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip sits staring at the flame of the candle. The whole world waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 130 A ship's lamp sways in the window. A sailor notes the movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DoubleGreen Revision - 22 July - p.101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind change! High in the rigging above, a sail flaps and bellies in a new direction. The sound of a rising storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 Elizabeth looks around her as the tent shudders in the rising wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast Armada is being buffeted by the storm, but still it comes on. The sea is in turmoil, lightning streaks across the darkening sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Drop Anchor!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Our orders are to stay in                                formation.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (If we don't drop anchor, we'll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be smashed on the rocks!) 133

dialogues.speaker: EXT SPANISH SHIP
dialogues.text: Spanish sailors furl the sails, haul in ropes. An anchor crashes into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 134 Raleigh and Drake hurry along the deck in the whipping wi and spray. Drake is watching the Spanish fleet, and shouting above the noise of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've dropped anchor. These                             Spanish monsters can't handle our                         English seas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the wind in our favour.                           Do we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go.                                                    DoubleYellow - 22 July- p.101A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake embraces Raleigh. Action at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God speed, my friend. And don't                          forget to jump. 1

dialogues.speaker: INT QUEEN TENT, TILBURY
dialogues.text: 35 The tent is full of commotion, soldiers and ministers com in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DoubleGreen- 22 July- p.102

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under whose orders is he acting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was told not to risk any more ships of the fleet. Elizabeth is distant from the general hubbub.

dialogues.speaker: EXT THE TYGER
dialogues.text: 136 Raleigh at the helm of the Tyger gazing intently ahead. Before him, the might of the Spanish Armada. Behind him, men move down the ship with barrels, pouring pitch over t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: decks. Calley lights a torch and hands it to Raleigh. 137

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spanish sailors watch in horror as the spreading flames o the fire-ships move inexorably toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 138 A Spanish officer reacts to the danger and shouts command

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Raise anchor! Quickly! No - cut                          the ropes! Cut the ropes!)                                Ropes are slashed by flailing axes and cut away from the capstan.

dialogues.speaker: INT PHILIP'S CELL
dialogues.text: 139 Philip stares in horror at the flickering candle. The far off sound of the storm wind.

dialogues.speaker: 140A
dialogues.text: Elizabeth's entourage look at the maps stretched out on t tables. Hatton enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many Spanish ships are burning? Hatton murmurs a figure. May 1 Blue Draft - p.103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough. ON ELIZABETH- Staring out, as if to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One empire will rise, and one will fall...

dialogues.speaker: EXT THE TYGER
dialogues.text: 141 Raleigh on the prow of the Tyger as it sails towards the Spanish fleet. He holds a flaming torch, and calmly surve his target. He lights the fuses on the prow and tosses th torch behind him. The pitch on the deck bursts into flame He runs to the side of the ship and scales down the rigging. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 Chaos and panic amongst the Spanish sailors as the fire- ship approaches. Men wildly fire off their muskets and th cannons boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 Cannonballs crash into the side of the flaming Tyger. Certain now of the ship's course, Raleigh finally leaps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: into the water. As seen from underwater, Raleigh swims aw from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TYGER
dialogues.text: 144 The prelaid fuses amongst the Tyger's cannons ignite, as the Tyger smashes into the side of the Spanish ship. From beneath, we see the hulls collide.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SPANISH SHIP
dialogues.text: 145 The Tyger's cannons explode causing devastation on the Spanish deck. Sailors run for cover. A horse rears and jumps over the side.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ENGLISH CHANNEL
dialogues.text: 146 From underneath, men leap into the water. A horse swims past, lit from flames above. DoubleGoldenrod - 25 July -p.103A

dialogues.speaker: 146A
dialogues.text: John Dee stands on his roof, looking at the sky through a sextant.

dialogues.speaker: 146B
dialogues.text: Raleigh, singed and wet from his exploits, is with Drake the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many ships are burning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough.                                            He turns his face towards the coast of England. He speaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as if to her, a quiet heart-felt prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May God be with us all tonight. May 1 Blue Draft - p.104

dialogues.speaker: INT PHILIP'S CELL
dialogues.text: 147 The candle flickers. A clap of thunder, and the candle go out.

dialogues.speaker: 147A
dialogues.text: Elizabeth looks out to sea. The wind roars, the clouds race, the lightning flashes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ENGLISH CHANNEL
dialogues.text: 148 Images of the beginning of the destruction of the Armada: Philip's portrait is covered by water inside a sinking cabin; a Madonna statue floats; a Spanish battle flag bur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: into flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 Raging waves, black sea. The howl of the storm, the rendi of breaking timbers, the screams of drowning men. Somewhe out there, tiny in the vast seascape, the Armada is being smashed into oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HILL ABOVE THE ENGLISH CAMP- NIGHT
dialogues.text: 152 Elizabeth stands there drinking in the tempest, the wind lashing her clothes and hair, but she loves it, lives it, breathes it. This is her storm - her victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 The space that echoed before to the chants of war is sile now. Philip and the Infanta come down the nave. Philip's face set, expressionless. Philip reaches the steps at the foot of the altar. He goe down on his knees. Then he drops further down, to abase himself on the hard stone floor. The cardinals turn their backs to him.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he Infanta remains standing beside him, impassive, starin at nothing. She throws down her Elizabeth doll. May 1 Blue Draft - p.105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low sob from Philip.

dialogues.speaker: 153A
dialogues.text: Elizabeth triumphant in the roaring wind.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ENGLISH COAST
dialogues.text: 154 From inside a cave looking out to sea, a scene of devastation. Dead Spanish sailors have been washed up amongst planks, barrels and a torn Spanish ensign. A long scream of pain -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 CLOSE ON BESS - Screaming in pain. A final spasm passes through her. She sinks back. The cry of a new-born child. She hears, and her exhausted face lights up with a radiant smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 157 Walsingham lies in bed, his eyes closed. His wife Ursula and daughter Mary in the background. He's dying.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: lizabeth has come to him. She looks down on him with deep concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis. My old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 An anonymous man - Agent 3 - walks down a shabby Paris street. Stops before a small anonymous house. Knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 159 The anonymous man is let into the house by a figure we don't yet see. He looks round the room. A fire burning in the grate. English books on the table. A half-eaten meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come from your brother. Now we see who he speaks to: William. May 1 Blue Draft - p.106

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asks your forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My forgiveness? On William: he stares. Then he understands. Fear brings sudden tears to his eyes. A gasp. Walsingham's man has plunged a knife into his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 160 Walsingham speaks to his Queen with difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have served your majesty - in all things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it, old friend. Don't leave me now. Walsingham's eyes open. A weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Y
dialogues.text: ou don't need me any more. Permission - to go - Elizabeth looks tenderly down on him, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always did do as you pleased, whether I wanted it or not. I've no doubt you'll do as you please now. He lets his eyes close. She stoops down and kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161 We see Raleigh from behind. He's holding something, and dancing slowly about, and crooning a low song, in the oddest way. Beyond him, half-glimpsed, an inner room, where Bess is resting on a bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in his solitary dance Raleigh turns, and we see he's holding a new-born BABY BOY. He kisses the baby's little bald head, and sings his wordless song. Footsteps outside. The door opens, and a royal servant enters, followed by other servants and guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her majesty the Queen! Elizabeth enters, in formal style. She stands and takes i the scene - Raleigh holding his baby son - the room beyon Bess rises at once and comes through to make her curtsey the Queen. Elizabeth seems not to see her. A regal wave at the servants and guards. They withdraw. Elizabeth stalks round the room. No reason to suppose her displeasure has passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the birth?

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: our nights ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother is well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. Now Elizabeth turns to Bess, and their eyes meet. The Que puts out her hand and touches Bess lightly on one cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: silent forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son is well. Now for the first time she looks at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Elizabeth has a child. You                        must be proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Elizabeth moves away, unable to bear seeing the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fulfilled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As any man can be.                                 Elizabeth looks at him in silence for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you still dream of your shining city, your New World?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than ever.                                    She turns to go. But before she reaches the door, she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to give your son my blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be honoured. Elizabeth takes the baby in her arms. She holds him carefully. She finds herself more moved than she had expected. She bends her head over him, and turns her back on Raleigh. Raleigh watches and waits. And waits. ON ELIZABETH: her cheek pressed to the baby's head. Her eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am called the Virgin Queen. And

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yet I have many children... You are all my children. There is no                   jewel, be it never so rich a                       prize, which I put before this                     jewel: I mean, your love. I want                   no more wars. England is enough                    for me. I want no lordship over                    your souls. Only a free people                     can love.                                          (Beat)                                         And in your love - is my life.
